results.title: Holiday
results.brief_description: From ABC Television’s award-winning and popularly acclaimed travel program ‘Holiday’ comes a series of eight fabulous videos covering every facet of holidaying in the states and territories of Australia. Whether you’re looking for a luxury five star resort or the chance to get off the beaten track, this series has got Australia covered.

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world (TEFC): experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: Tasmania
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Tasmania’s attractions highlighted in this video range from the picturesque landscapes of Cataract Gorge, Cradle Mountain and Flinders Island to relaxing sporting events such as fishing at London Lakes and viewing the Targa Road Race. Visit historical Port Arthur, Hawley House and the grave of Tom Roberts and indulge in a novelty stop-over at a reproduction Swiss Village.

results.title: Technology at work (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomas, Riverfront Pictures and TVC London
results.brief_description: Technological innovations have radically changed the workplace and this video examines the way that they have changed the role of workers, whether by loss of jobs or a change in work methods. Factory, office and retail employees are questioned about how the changes were introduced, whether they were given adequate training and the effect it has had on them.

results.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Learning Series”
Dr Sam Rabinovitch explains some of the methods used in teaching children with learning disabilities due to poor listening ability or poor bodily coordination. Points out how important it is that the child learns and understands what is being taught.

results.title: On the Birdsville Track
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The most infamous bush track runs for 540 kilometres through Australia’s centre. Its history is one of personal hardships and tough pioneering people. Once goods were carried to remote cattle properties by camel and only in recent times was a road made across the sand dunes. Jack Absalom recalls the old times, meets newcomers to “The Birdsville Track” and has some sound travel advice. Rated: G

results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.

results.title: Old enough but not ready: early recognition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Learning Series”.
Derek behaves as if he had difficulty uttering words; Eugene is unable to follow verbal instructions such as “left”, “first, “after”; Mark has yet to use his hands as though the fingers are ten distinct elements. Children of six and seven who are bright and cheerful but for various reasons are not yet able to cope with the demands made in a Grade One classroom. Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains the advantage of early recognition of learning disabilities in children. Shows the learning and teaching difficulties of these children.

results.title: King Island
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
At the western end of treacherous Bass Strait King Island is noted in the history books for the frequency of shipwrecks on its rocky shores. But in recent times it is getting a reputation for the quality of its tender beef and gourmet cheese…not to mention the “characters” that the so called “forgotten” island has attracted in recent years. Jack Absalom found it one of the most friendly places he’d visited and concluded that its name should be changed to “the Magic Island”.
